Midas Documentation » SECTION 5: Run Control » Run Control Programs » mhttpd: the MIDAS Web-based Run Control utility

Custom pages




Introduction

Custom web pages provide the user with a means of creating secondary user-created web page(s) activated within the standard MIDAS web interface. These custom pages can contain specific links to the ODB, and therefore can present the essential parameters of the controlled experiment in a more compact way. A custom page may even replace the default MIDAS Status Page.

Examples of Custom Webpages

Examples of custom webpages :

  • Custom Page showing ROOT analyzer output - ROOT graphical output served through an mhttpd custom page
  • Custom Page for MEG gas system - complex gas system illustrating use of "fills" and "labels"
  • Custom Pages for Ebit Experiment - page showing clickable input boxes, checkboxes
  • Mpet Optics Custom Page - page showing labels
  • Custom Pages designed for T2K gas system - highly complex gas system showing popups, labels, fills, clickable areas
  • Custom Status Pages for experiments BNMR and BNQR - custom status page replaces MIDAS standard status page


Two ways of implementing custom pages are available:

  1. Internal
    • The html code is fully stored in the Online Database (ODB).
    • Limited capability, size restricted.
    • The page is web editable.
  2. External
    • ODB contains links to external html or Javascript document(s).
    • Multiple custom pages are supported,
    • The page can be edited with an external editor.


External pages are more commonly used, hence most of the examples in this section are those of external pages. All the features described are available for both internal and external pages. An example of an internal page is shown here.

  • How to activate custom page(s) in the ODB
  • JavaScript built-in library mhttpd.js
  • Features available on custom pages
